CHARACTERIZATION OF VARIANTS CMD1HH TRP-218 AND PRO-462

comment.text: Co-chaperone for HSP70 and HSC70 chaperone proteins. Acts as a nucleotide-exchange factor (NEF) promoting the release of ADP from the HSP70 and HSC70 proteins thereby triggering client/substrate protein release. Nucleotide release is mediated via its binding to the nucleotide-binding domain (NBD) of HSPA8/HSC70 where as the substrate release is mediated via its binding to the substrate-binding domain (SBD) of HSPA8/HSC70 (PubMed:9873016, PubMed:27474739). Has anti-apoptotic activity (PubMed:10597216). Plays a role in the HSF1 nucleocytoplasmic transport (PubMed:26159920).

Binds to the ATPase domain of HSP70/HSC70 chaperones (PubMed:9873016). Interacts with BCL2 (PubMed:10597216). Interacts with phospholipase C-gamma proteins (PubMed:10980614). Interacts with DNAJB6 (PubMed:22366786). Interacts (via BAG domain) with HSF1; this interaction occurs in normal and heat-shocked cells promoting HSF1 nucleocytoplasmic shuttling (PubMed:26159920). Interacts with HSPA8 (via NBD) (PubMed:27474739, PubMed:24318877). Interacts with HSPA1A (via NBD) and HSPA1B (via NBD) (PubMed:24318877). Interacts (via WW domain 1) with SYNPO2 (via PPPY motif) (PubMed:23434281). Interacts with HSPB8 (PubMed:28144995).
Colocalizes with HSF1 to the nucleus upon heat stress (PubMed:26159920).

disease.name: Myopathy, myofibrillar, 6
disease.description: A form of myofibrillar myopathy, a group of chronic neuromuscular disorders characterized at ultrastructural level by disintegration of the sarcomeric Z disk and myofibrils, and replacement of the normal myofibrillar markings by small dense granules, or larger hyaline masses, or amorphous material. MFM6 is characterized by early-onset of severe, progressive, diffuse muscle weakness associated with cardiomyopathy, severe respiratory insufficiency during adolescence, and a rigid spine in some patients.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

disease.name: Cardiomyopathy, dilated 1HH
disease.description: A disorder characterized by ventricular dilation and impaired systolic function, resulting in congestive heart failure and arrhythmia. Patients are at risk of premature death.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2); alternate
In MFM6; interferes with the differentiation of skeletal muscle cells; does not cause functional alterations in cardiomyocyte cells; dbSNP:rs121918312.
In CMD1HH; interferes with the assembly of Z-disks; increases stress-induced apoptosis; dbSNP:rs397514506.
